result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael Norbert MALCHEK was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with all sentences imposed on 14 CF 97, 14 CF 156, 14 CF 157 and concurrent with the sentence presently being served in Kewaukee County.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Submit to random urine screens and pay for same.

Maintain absolute sobriety.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

NO CONTEST pleas entered to count 1, bail jumping and count 4, theft.  Convicted.

Minutes.

The Court hereby orders that the personal recognizance bond in this case be modified as follows:  the condition that the defendant must report to the Manitowoc County Sheriff's Department daily by 12:00 noon and the defendant must submit to random drug test at his own expense within 7 days of test, is removed as a condition.  Defendant is currently on probation hold for Kewaunee County case no: 14 CF 41.

Defendant's Notice of Motion; Defendant's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.

The Court hereby orders that the condition of bail requiring daily jail report be changed from by noon everyday to by 4:30 p.m. everyday.

$750.00 cash bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.

Defendant in custody.   
Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 2 for further proceedings.  Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing. 
ARRAIGNMENT 
Information filed.  Not guilty pleas.  Jury Calendar.  Settlement conference with the District Attorney is set for 05-28-14 at 11:30 a.m.  State's Motion and Demand for Discovery.  
MOTION TO MODIFY BAIL
Counsel argue.  Court modifies bail to $750.00 cash with the conditions that defendant is to report daily to the Manitowoc County Sheriff's Department by noon.  Defendant is to submit to random drug testing to be paid within 7 days of the test.  Defendant is to have no contact with Terry Preston or the residence at 2930 CTH S., Cato, WI.
Notice of Motion and Motion to Modify Bond.

Defendant in custody.  
Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing is set for 05-07-14 at 2:30 p.m.  
Minutes.
RE:  Bail jumping, on 04-30-14.

Defendant in custody.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of criminal trespass to land, theft and bail jumping.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 05-05-14 at 2:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $1,500.00 cash with the conditions that he have no contact with Terry Preston or residence at 2930 CTH S, Cato, WI.  Bail not furnished and the defendant is remanded into custody.  Commitment for failure to furnish bail issued.  Copy filed.
Probable Cause Statement and Judicial Determination.
Minutes.
